meanings.definition: Excess stock or inventory beyond what is needed or desired.
meanings.sent1: The store had an overstock of toys after the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse manager ordered more products, leading to an overstock issue.
meanings.sent3: The overstock of candy made the children's eyes widen with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her closet was an overstock of shoes, overflowing with options.
meanings.sent5: The overstock of books created a colorful mountain in the corner of the room.

meanings.definition: To have more stock or inventory than is needed or desired.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to overstock on supplies to avoid running out.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overstock her pantry with snacks, just in case.
meanings.sent3: He would overstock his backpack with snacks for the hiking trip.
meanings.sent4: The farmer chose to overstock the barn with hay for the upcoming winter.
meanings.sent5: The shop owner would overstock on popular items to meet the high demand.
